definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Kicking the shuttlecock has sharpened my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 踢毽子增进了我的食欲。

sentences.english: Do not know when, I am very good at playing shuttlecock.
sentences.chinese: 不知道什么时候，我非常善于玩踢毽子。

sentences.english: Hot noisy make of kick a shuttlecock game in the one the joys the voice the joke be over.
sentences.chinese: 热热闹闹的踢毽子比赛在一片欢声笑语中结束了。

sentences.english: It is useful to kick the shuttlecock every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天踢毽子对你有好处。

sentences.english: You should keep balance when you kick the shuttlecock, or you may fall down on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 踢毽子时你要保持身体平衡，否则就会摔倒在地。

sentences.english: Shuttlecock not only exercises your body, but your brain as well.
sentences.chinese: 踢毽子不仅锻炼身体，也增进脑力。

sentences.english: We kicked the shuttlecock in the yard.
I feel deadly tired after kicking the shuttlecock.
sentences.chinese: 踢毽子之后，我感到非常疲惫。

sentences.english: A shuttlecock was a rounded piece of cork with feathers stuck ontop.
sentences.chinese: 毽子是一块圆形而顶端有毛的软木塞。

sentences.english: Of course, our long rope still has its charm.
sentences.chinese: 传统项目跳长绳，踢毽子，仍旧倍受追捧。

sentences.english: The first student to be the winner.
sentences.chinese: 先套到毽子的学生获胜。

sentences.english: At Sheng Xin, we sometimes used the shuttlelecock to play adifferent game.
sentences.chinese: 在圣心，我们通常会用毽子来玩不同的游戏。

sentences.english: I played hacky sack with my friends.
Come and kick shuttlecock with us.
sentences.chinese: 过来跟我们一起踢毽子吧。

sentences.english: I like to play basketball and shuttlecocks.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢打篮球和踢毽子。

definition: to play rubber band jump rope
cricket (ball game)/also called 板球[ban3 qiu2]
